result.execSummary:
The defendant Raja M Khan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 108 days of sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Case 10CF338, if revoked.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Concurrent with: Extended Supervision in Case 10CF338.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution ($4,936.15) to be paid as follows:  $1,130 to Hardees and $3,806.15 to United Fire Group Insurance.  Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.  Defendant's two outstanding paychecks to be applied to restitution.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Gambling Addiction Treatment/Counseling and follow through.
NO GAMLING through any means.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Raja M Khan in court, in custody (Fox Lake Correctional), with attorney M Elizabeth Weathers.
Victim rights has been complied with.

Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3 Years
Initial Incarceration:   18 Months
Extended Supervision:  18 Months
108 Days of Credit
Consecutive to Waukesha County Case 10CF338 if revoked
STAYED

If revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 Years
Concurrent to the Extended Supervision on Waukesha County Case 10CF338  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Gambling Addiction Treatment/Counseling and follow through 
NO GAMBLING through any means.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

Restitution:  $4,936.15 (Breakdown:  $1,130 - Hardees & $3,806.15 - United Fire Group Insurance) - to be paid first.
(Defendant's 2 outstanding pay checks should be applied to the restitution).
Costs: $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge: $250
DRGOD Surcharge: $10
To be paid as a condition of probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to be returned to Fox Lake Correctional - FORTHWITH
